p: From ancient times, the essential oils (EOs) of herbal plants and other plant extracts have attracted the attention and interest of researchers as sources of bioactive natural products. EOs were reported to exhibit several significant biological activities as antioxidant and antimicrobial agents as well as have the potential for food preservation [ 1, 2]. The free radicals play a critical role in human health in relation to oxidative stress; they damage the cell components, resulting in cellular and metabolic injury in the form of inflammation, as well as cardiovascular and cancer diseases [ 2].
